page.title: 02SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: The proposed route of a{by-pass}to divert the A46 road around Newark passes close to houses and farmland in this block. The majority of residents object on the following grounds: a)Increased noise and pollution with no offers of compensation. b)Safety risk to pedestrians and cyclists using Winthorpe Rd. c)Detrimental{environmental}change will adversely affect the market value of private properties. One resident, a farmer, vigorously objects to an extension of the route which will take traffic to the A17 east of Coddington. The road will slice through his farm, fragmenting his property,making the movement of implements hazardous and resulting in the loss of rich land to{ {agriculture .}
